feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Business Technology Platform
feed.subtitle: SAP Business Technology Platform Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Issue with setting up connectivity from BTP to Converged Cloud
entry.content:
We are trying to run a script as a Cloud Foundry function on BTP to pull data from Converged Cloud (asset data) , and we are failing to connect despite having the cloud connector set up (On the cloud connector page, it says "available" for the converged cloud endpoints that we set up). Also, the code runs locally just fine.

Did someone else face a similar challenge, or do you have any idea who we could work with to troubleshoot this?

Thanks in advance for your time and help!

Petr

The error:

Authentication error at https://identity-3.ap-ae-1.cloud.sap/v3/auth/tokens: HTTPSConnectionPool(host='identity-3.ap-ae-1.cloud.sap', port=443): Max retries exceeded with url: /v3/auth/tokens (Caused by NameResolutionError("<urllib3.connection.HTTPSConnection object at 0x10689f0e0>: Failed to resolve 'identity-3.ap-ae-1.cloud.sap' ([Errno 8] nodename nor servname provided, or not known)"))

entry.title: How to Implement Dynamic XSLT or Groovy Transformations in SAP CPI Based on Message Context?
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I'm working on a complex integration scenario using SAP Cloud Integration (CPI), where incoming messages can vary in structure and must be transformed differently depending on:

  • The message content (specific fields or data structure)

  • Custom headers or properties passed from upstream systems

I want to apply different XSLT or Groovy scripts at runtime, without creating multiple iFlows or hardcoding every possible condition into a single transformation.

My Questions:

  1. How can I dynamically apply different XSLT or Groovy scripts based on runtime conditions (e.g., a header field like Document Type)?

  2. Is there a way to modularize and externalize scripts or transformations so they can be reused or loaded conditionally in the iFlow?

  3. What are the performance considerations or limitations when using conditional script execution or dynamic resource loading in CPI?

  4. Can this be combined with Content Modifier or Router patterns to maintain readability and reusability of the iFlow?

  5. Are there any recommended design patterns for managing complex transformation logic dynamically in CPI projects?

What I’ve Tried:

  • I’ve used Groovy scripts with if-else blocks to call different logic branches, but this becomes hard to manage at scale.

  • I’ve explored externalizing scripts using Script Collection, but couldn’t find a way to dynamically load them at runtime based on message properties.

  • I read that dynamic script execution might be possible with evaluate() in Groovy, but I’m unsure of its security and performance impact in CPI.

Goal:

Design a scalable and maintainable approach to apply runtime-dependent transformations (XSLT or Groovy) within a single iFlow based on message metadata or structure.

Any best practices, examples, or gotchas would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,
YERUVA PRANEETH REDDY

entry.title: Not able to create a new account of BTP trial
entry.content:
Dear Team,

While trying to create a new BTP trial account, it is not creating one, with the message as 'Due to high demand, signing to a new account is currently not possible.'

Can you please support.

Regards.

entry.title: S/4 Hana Extensibility Service Instance
entry.content:
I have an application on SAP BTP. The application has few service bindings. For example : application-x has eleven bindings. Ten of them are of type s4-hana-cloud and one of them is xsuaa. I do understand that why we have binded xsuaa but I don't understand the use case of s4-hana-cloud bindings. 

Why do we need instance of s4-hana-cloud ? Also, I want to learn side by side extension development. Is there a good tutorial that outlines step by step guide? I want to use Cloud SDK for typescript code generation and then call some API from SAP Business Acclerator Hub. I understand few things. For example : Downloading edmx, then use cloud SDK to generate code and use that code on my service, creating destination. But I don't know how to put all these together. 

Help me with this. Thanks. Any paid course or resource is also highly appreciated. If you have question , then don't hesitate to ask.

entry.title: SAP build work zone, standard edition
entry.content:
Hello experts, 

I am unable to access SAP build work zone, standard edition in my subaccount AWS east (VA), but i can access it in AZURE.

entry.title: Helm install issue when following tutorial for CDM to integrate application with SAP Build workzone
entry.content:
I am following the tutorial https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/integrate-with-work-zone-kymaruntime.html with respect to CDM  for deploying application to kyma.
Tutorial mentions to delete the destination configuration in chart/values.yaml. However after doing the step when one does the helm install command, it throws an exception saying no value for destination service instance and plan found

I reckon this is because destination has also been bound in the srv configuration

Tutorial only says to delete destination binding in the html5-deployer section.

Should one also go ahead and delete the destination binding for srv as well

entry.title: Cloud Foundry - TCP Communication
entry.content:
We are deploying an application with multiple services that need to communicate internally. One of the services is a gRPC-based database. Since the Cloud Foundry environment on SAP BTP does not support container-to-container networking or TCP routes, we cannot connect to the database.

Is there any recommended workaround or alternative approach to enable internal service communication in this setup?

entry.title: Unable to Connect SAP Business Application Studio to Visual Studio Code
entry.content: I am encountering an issue when attempting to connect to SAP Business Application Studio from Visual Studio Code using the SAP Business Application Studio Toolkit extension. I'm receiving an error message stating, 'Error running command local-extension.login: Personal Access Token is required. This is likely caused by the extension that contributes local-extension.login.' Additionally, there's a 'Login time out in 60000 ms.' notification. I am unsure why this error is occurring and how to resolve it. Any guidance or solutions would be greatly appreciated. The system I use is Public Cloud.

entry.title: Getting Started with SAP Open Connectors
entry.content:
Introduction to SAP Open Connectors

In today’s fast-paced digital landscape, seamless integration across various systems and applications is crucial for business success. SAP Open Connectors, a key capability within the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), is designed to simplify and accelerate this process.

SAP Open Connectors offers a unified API integration layer that streamlines connectivity to over 160 third-party cloud applications, including popular platforms like Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics, Google services, and more.

Instead of building and maintaining individual connectors for each application, Open Connectors provides prebuilt connectors with standardized APIs, helping developers avoid the complexity of dealing with diverse authentication methods, pagination formats, error handling, and data models.

Assign Roles in BTP

  • OpenConnectorsAdmin
  • OpenConnectorsUser
  • OpenConnectorsDeveloper

Prerequisites:

  • SAP BTP account (Open Connectors supports trial accounts)

Demonstrate on how to connect Gmail API Connector

Firstly, Add the capabilities for Open Connectors on the Integration Suite. After that, we should assign the role related to Open Connectors.

Step 1: Integration suite Home page >> Capabilities >> Manage Capabilities. Click on “Manage Capabilities”.

Step 2: Click on “Add Capabilities”

Step 3: Click on check box i.e., Extend Non-Sap Connectivity

Step 4: After the above step, you will see the below mentioned in Home Page. Click on “Create Connectors”. After this step, you will be navigate to Open Connectors Home Page.

Open Connectors Configuration

Now, we will be working on Gmail Connector. After navigating to Open Connectors Home Page. You will be able to see the below page. Just, Search for the Gmail in search box.  

Connectors >> Gmail >> My Resources (place the cursor in Gmail connector, then only you can see the Resources) >> Authenticate Instance.

I am creating a new instance with the name of “DemoGmail”.

After this step, you will be redirected to a different page or click this url 

  • https://console.cloud.google.com/

Get Gmail OAuth Credentials 

  • Create a new project or use existing
  • Click on "Select a project".

Give Project Name as Your wish. e.g. My Project - 1 >> Click on "Create". In the search bar, type Gmail API >> Click on Gmail API >> Click Enable.

After enabling your API, you will be redirect to another page.

At this Step:

  • Navigate to Credentials
  • Click on Create Credential
  • Select OAuth client ID

 

  • Click on "Configure consent screen".

  • Click on "Get Started" which is highlighted in blue color.

Give all the details

  • App name: Test
  • User support email: "Give your mail id e.g. xxxx@gmail.com"
  • Choose "External"
  • Contact Information: Give your mail id
  • Click "Agree" checkbox >> Continue >> Create

When you have this page, click on "Create OAuth client".

Fill the details as mentioned in below Image.

Skip "Authorized JavaScript origins"

In "Authorized redirect URIs", Click "Add URI" >> give the urI as mentioned in below image >> Click on "Create". 

Download your credentials by clicking on Download JSON or else you can copy & paste in your notepad. Click on OK.

Go to Hamburger button which is located on Top Left side. You can see API & Services as shown in below image. click on it.

API & Services >> Credentials >> Audience >> Add Users (add your mail id) >> click on "Save".

 Data Access >> Add or remove scopes >> add below scopes >> add to table >> click on update.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.send

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.modify

Navigate to your open connectors, give your client credentials, create instance.

You will see the below page with success popup.

Click on Test in the API docs

GET: Retrieves data or resources from the server (ex: fetch mail messages). Follow the below images highlighted with red rectangle. 

When you're complete your execution, if no errors you will get 200 message.

entry.title: At least one IBP Write Batch could not be created" during IBP master data upload via CI
entry.content:
Hi SAP Experts,

I'm trying to load LOCATION master data from SAP Integration Suite (CPI) to SAP IBP using the IBP Write API.

In my integration flow, I first create the batch using this payload:

Then I use a Groovy script to convert CSV to JSON and wrap it in the following payload:

However, I get the following error:
javax.script.ScriptException: java.lang.Exception: java.lang.Exception: At least one IBP Write Batch could not be created.

I have verified:

  • BatchKey is the same in both steps.

  • CSV structure and field names are correct.

  • IBP destination in BTP is properly configured.

  • The user has the required roles (SAP_IBP_INTEGRATION) and access to planning area ZHCRVRDEM.

Can someone help me understand why the batch creation might be failing? How can I trace this better or fix it?

Thanks in advance!

 



SAP Integration Suite SAP Integrated Business Planning SAP Integration Suite, managed gateway for spend management and SAP Business Network

entry.title: ABAP Platform pipeline in SAP CI/CD Service - release issue
entry.content:
Hi, 

I have a problem with my ABAP Platform pipeline, using SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery Service in BTP. The issue is with the Release part.

I have a Cloud Connector and destination (using Principal Propagation) ready. The deployment from SAP BAS works as expected. All necessary OData Services are active and whitelisted. However, there's 401 error when the pipeline is executed.

[2025-07-29T14:59:03.441Z] Sending GET request to http://XXX:400/sap/opu/odata/UI5/ABAP_REPOSITORY_SRV/
[2025-07-29T14:59:03.677Z] Release stage credentials successfully validated against endpoint
...
[2025-07-29T14:59:23.345Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - No deploy dependencies provided. Skipping npm install call. Assuming current docker image already contains the dependencies for performing the deployment.
[2025-07-29T14:59:23.345Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - running shell script: /bin/sh #!/bin/sh -e
[2025-07-29T14:59:23.345Z] fiori deploy --failfast --yes --username ABAP_USER --password ABAP_PASSWORD --description "Pipeline Test" --config "ui5-deploy.yaml" --url http://XXX:400 --transport GXXXXXXXX --package Z_PACKAGE --name Z_TEST
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [32minfo[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Creating archive with UI5 build result.
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [32minfo[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Archive created.
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [32minfo[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Starting to deploy.
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [31merror[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Deployment has failed.
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [31merror[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Change logging level to debug your issue
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [31merror[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST 	(see examples https://github.com/SAP/open-ux-tools/tree/main/packages/deploy-tooling#configuration-with-logging-enabled)
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [31merror[39m builder:custom deploy-to-abap Request failed with status code 401
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.279Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - Command deploy failed with error : Request failed with status code 401
[2025-07-29T14:59:42.331Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - fatal error: errorDetails{"category":"undefined","correlationId":"n/a","error":"running shell script failed with /bin/sh: cmd.Run() failed: exit status 1","library":"SAP/jenkins-library","message":"step execution failed","result":"failure","stepName":"transportRequestUploadCTS","time":"2025-07-29T14:59:39.890292594Z"}
[2025-07-29T14:59:42.332Z] fatal transportRequestUploadCTS - step execution failed - running shell script failed with /bin/sh: cmd.Run() failed: exit status 1

 I use Job Editor configuration mode. No code is used for the pipeline. 

Upload credentials is Basic Auth. using my Username and Password. These are no issues with it, as I've tested successfully.

I also use Cloud Connector, with Location ID specified on the destination level.

I have a couple of doubts:

- I see the --config "ui5-deploy.yaml" is used. Is there any special ui5-deploy content I have to add? I use destination there.

- Is ABAP Platform Endpoint the URL that I can find on my Destination level?

- Location ID - documentation says it should be found on the Cloud Connector level in BTP Cockpit, but it's false. There's Location ID, but only on the Destination level.

Any idea what could be the issue?

BR,

Adrian

entry.title: Issue Deploying SAP Build Process Automation: Application Not Active After Deployment
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I’m working through the official SAP Build Process Automation tutorial: Build Your First Business Process with SAP Build Process Automation.

On the last step (Run the Business Process), when I try to deploy my application, I get an error message. Despite the message, I continued and deployed the application, but after deployment, the application is not set to "active"—this is different from what is shown in the final step image in the tutorial.

Has anyone experienced this issue before? Does anyone know what this message means and how to solve the "not active" problem after deployment?

Any help or suggestions would be much appreciated!

Thanks!

entry.title: Build Workflow with SAP Build Process Automation: A Step-by-Step Demo on Invoice Validation Approval
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

In this blog, we’ll walk through the steps to create your very first process using SAP Build Process Automation (SBPA). We’ll implement an Vendor Invoice Validation and Approval Process, where a Finance Clerk submits a vendor invoice, and a Finance Manager approves or rejects it. You'll also learn how to set up your environment in a SAP BTP trial account, configure prerequisites, and monitor your workflow execution.

Understanding SAP Build Solutions

SAP Build is a comprehensive suite of low-code/no-code tools that empowers citizen developers and business users to create applications and automate processes without extensive coding knowledge. The SAP Build portfolio consists of three main components:

SAP Build Apps

  • Create and extend business applications
  • Drag-and-drop simplicity for app development
  • No coding skills required

SAP Build Process Automation

  • Create workflows and automate repetitive tasks
  • Unifies workflow management and intelligent robotic process automation
  • Streamlines business process management

SAP Build Work Zone

  • Create beautiful business websites and corporate portals
  • Centralized access to business applications and content

All these tools leverage drag-and-drop functionality, making them accessible to users without programming expertise.

Prerequisites

  • SAP BTP Trial Setup
  • Ensure that you have a SAP BTP trial account with the following services enabled:   
  • A. SAP Build Process Automation (Free Tier or Standard Plan)
    • Navigate to Service Marketplace > Search for SAP Build Process Automation
    • Click Create Application if it’s not already available.

                  

  • B. SAP Cloud Identity Services (CIS)
    • Configure IAS (Identity Authentication Service).
    • Either use the default IAS tenant of your BTP trial or configure an additional tenant or default plan if needed.        

Subscribe to SAP Build Process Automation and Cloud Identity Service into your sub-account.         

  • Role Collection Assignment in BTP Cockpit
  • Assign the following role collections to the user you’ll log in with:                 

Go to BTP Cockpit > Security > Users

Select the IAS user and assign above role collection

  1. Establish Trust with IAS
  2. Go to BTP Subaccount > Security > Trust Configuration
  3. Add a new Identity Provider if you are using a custom IAS tenant
  4.  Enable trust for that IAS and assign the user created in IAS

Step 1: Accessing SAP Build Process Automation

  1. Navigate to your SAP BTP subaccount
  2. Go to Services → Instances and Subscriptions
  3. Open the SAP Build Process Automation application
  4. You'll be directed to the SAP Build Lobby - the central entry point for all SAP Build tools    

Step 2: Creating a Business Process Project

  1. In the SAP Build Lobby, click the Create button
  2. Select Build an Automated Process
  3. Choose Business Process
  4. Create a new project with these details:
    • Project Name: Invoice Validation Approval Process Form
    • Description: A invoice validation and approval process form project
  5. Click Create

The project acts as a container to hold the business process and all related artifacts.              

Step 3: Creating the Business Process

  1. Within the project, create a new business process:
    • Process Name: Invoice Validation Approval Process
    • Description: A invoice validation and approval process
  2. Click Create                  

The Process Builder will open with a vertical layout (an improvement from the previous horizontal layout) featuring a convenient side panel for better usability.

Hands-On Demo: Creating a Vendor Invoice Validation Approval Process

Let's dive into a practical example by creating a complete vendor invoice validation approval process. This demo will involve three key personas.

Business Personas Involved:

  1. Business Expert/Citizen Developer: Creates and designs the business process
  2. Finance Clerk: Uses the vendor invoice order from to initiate the process
  3. Finance Manager: Reviews and approves.rejects vendor invoice orders.

                    

Step 4: Creating the Vendor Invoice Submission Form (Trigger)

  1. Click Add a Trigger
  2. Select Submit Form (one of three trigger methods: Form, API, or Event)
  3. Click Blank Form
  4. Configure the form:
    • Form Name: Vendor Invoice Submission Form
    • Description: Form to collect vendor invoice order
  5. Click Create               

Step 5: Designing the Vendor Invoice Approval Form

  1. Click Open Editor to access the form designer
  2. Add form elements using drag-and-drop:
    • Heading: "Vendor Invoice Approval Forms"
    • Subheading: "Vendor Invoice Submission Form review by Finance Manager"
  3. Add required fields:
    • Vendor Name (Text field)
    • Invoice Number (Number field, required)
    • Invoice Date (Date field, required)
    • Vendor Email (Text field, required)
    • Invoice Amount (Number field, required)
    • Due Date (Date field, required)
  4. Mark fields as required where necessary
  5. Save the form       

Step 6: Creating the Approval Form

  1. Click Add Process Step (plus icon)
  2. Choose Approval
  3. Click Blank Approval
  4. Configure the approval form:
    • Name: Vendor Invoice Approval
    • Description: Vendor Invoice order form for review
  5. Click Create

Step 7: Designing the Approval Form

  1. Click the three dots and select Open Editor
  2. Design the form with:
    • Heading: "Sales Order Form for Review"
    • Subheading: "Sales order form for review by sales manager"
  3. Add the same fields as the trigger form:
    • Vendor Name
    • Invoice Number
    • Invoice Date
    • Vendor Email
    • Invoice Amount
    • Due Date
  4. Set all fields to Read Only (since this is for review)
  5. Add additional text field for manager comments
  6. Save the form

Step 8: Configuring the Approval Form

  1. Configure the approval settings:
    • Subject: "A Vendor Invoice [Vendor Name] form is waiting for your "
    • Priority: High
    • Users: Process started by (for simplification)
  2. Map inputs from the trigger form output:
    • Vendor Name→ Vendor Name field
    • Due Date → Due Date field
    • Invoice Number → Invoice Number field
    • Vendor Email → Vendor Email field
    • Invoice Amount → Invoice Amount field
  3. Save the configuration                     

Step 9: Creating Notification Forms

Approval Confirmation Form:

  1. Click Add Process Step → Form → Blank Form
  2. Configure:
    • Name: Vendor Invoice Order Confirmed
    • Description: Form to handle confirmation
  3. Design with:
    • Heading: "Vendor Invoice form approved successfully. No further action required."
    • Subject: "Your Vendor invoice [Vendor Name] form is confirmed!"
    • User: Process started by
  4. Save the form              

Rejection Notification Form:

  1. Go to Project Overview
  2. Duplicate the Order Confirmed form
  3. Modify the message:
    • Heading: "Invoice rejected. Please review remarks and resubmit after corrections."
    • Subject: "Your Vendor invoice [Vendor Name] has been rejected                   

Step 10: Connecting the Process Flow

  1. Connect the rejection notification to the "Rejected" path of the approval form
  2. Connect the approval confirmation to the "Approved" path
  3. Ensure both paths lead to the process end                      

Step 11: Understanding the Release Process

Why Release Before Deployment?

Before any business process can be executed by end users, it must go through two critical phases:

  1. Release: Creates a versioned snapshot of your project
  2. Deploy: Makes the released version available in runtime environment

Initiating the Release

  1. Locate the Release Button: In the top-right corner of your project interface
  2. Click Release: This opens the release configuration dialog

Release Versioning System

SAP Build Process Automation uses semantic versioning with three components:

  • Major Version (X.0.0): Significant changes, incompatible with previous versions
  • Minor Version (1.X.0): New features, backward compatible

First Release

For a newly created project, you'll see the default version 1.0.0. Add a meaningful release note such as "First release" and proceed.

Patch Changes (1.0.X)

  • Minor text modifications
  • Small UI adjustments
  • Bug fixes

Minor Changes (1.X.0)

  • New features added
  • Workflow enhancements
  • Backward-compatible improvements                       

Step 12: Deployment Process

Accessing Deployment Options

Once your project is released, the Deploy button becomes available. The deployment process involves:

  1. Click Deploy: Opens the deployment configuration
  2. Select Environment: Choose your target runtime environment

Understanding Environments

Public Environment

  • Accessible by all users in the subaccount
  • Suitable for organization-wide processes
  • Default choice for most scenarios

Deployment Execution

Select "Public" as your environment and click Deploy. You'll notice the project status changes from "Released" to "Deployed" and becomes "Active."       

Step 13: Process Execution and Testing

Accessing the Deployed Process

Once deployed, your process becomes executable through multiple channels:

  1. Direct Form Link: Browser-accessible URL
  2. SAP Build Work Zone Integration: Embedded as tiles
  3. SAP Launchpad Service: Integrated into portal environment         

Testing Scenario: Invoice Validation Approval Process Form

Phase 1: Finance Clerk Representative Role

Navigate to the deployed process and access the form link. As a finance clerk, fill out the order form:

Sample Data:

  • Vendor Name: ABCD Company
  • Invoice Number: 1234
  • Invoice Amount: $1,000
  • Due Date: 2 days from current date
  • Vendor Email : test@gmail.com
  • Invoice Date : 01/08/2025

Submit the form to initiate the workflow process.                           

Phase 2: Finance Manager Approval

  1. Access Inbox: Navigate to SAP Build Lobby > My Inbox
  2. Review Submission: Examine the submitted order details
  3. Make Decision: Choose to approve or reject based on business criteria

In our example:

  • Vendor Name: ABCD Company
  • Invoice Number: 1234
  • Invoice Amount: $1,000
  • Due Date: 2 days from current date
  • Vendor Email : test@gmail.com
  • Invoice Date : 01/08/2025

Decision: Approved with comment "This order can be fulfilled"      

Phase 3: Confirmation Process

After manager approval:

  1. Automatic Notification: System sends confirmation to finance representative
  2. Representative Action: Acknowledges receipt of approval
  3. Process Completion: Workflow concludes successfully

                        

Step 14: Process Monitoring and Analytics

Accessing Monitoring Tools

Process administrators can monitor workflow performance through: Path: SAP Build Lobby > Monitoring > Process and Workflow Instances

Key Monitoring Features

Process Instance Overview

  • Start time and initiator
  • Current status (Running, Completed, Failed)
  • Environment and version information
  • Instance ID for tracking

                     

Conclusion

SAP Build Process Automation is transforming the way organizations approach workflow digitisation by placing powerful automation tools directly in the hands of business users. As Demonstrated in our Invoice Validation Approval Process scenario, even non-technical users - like functional consultants or business experts - can quickly build, configure and deploy intelligent workflow using drag-and-drop interfaces, without writing code.  

From creating triggers  forms and configure approval steps to sending dynamic notifications, SBPA provides all the essential building blocks to automate repetitive tasks and improve collaboration across roles. Its tight integration within the SAP BTP and its ectensibility with tools like SAP Build Apps make it to go-to solutions.

By empowering citizen developer, SBPA not only reduces IT backlogs but also fosters a culture of innovations and continous improvement across teams. Now is the time to explore your business landscape, identify time-consuming manual process and turn them into streamlined intelligent workflows that deliver  measurable business value.

entry.title: Automation project cannot run with desktop agent
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I was creating an automation project in build process automation according to docu:

process-automation-enablement/Workshops/Workshop A - short/1 The Basics at main · SAP-samples/process-automation-enablement · GitHub 

Everything worked for me. When triggering the automation manually the Desktop agent runs the automation. When releasing the projekt and submitting my form, the automation gets stuck in this state and doesnt trigger the Agent to run in.

There is no error msg. Just stuck in this state for a day now

In my environment i registered my agent and added a custom attribute

Attribute is also added to my Project.

 

The Agent is installed on my local computer and has latest version. its in Unattended Mode, so it should register new projects.

This is my process:

this is the automation:

Greetings

Rouven

Check out all inspiring innovations from 2025 SAP Innovation Awards here!

entry.title: Questions on Certification Exam for "SAP Certified Professional - Solution Architect - SAP BTP"
entry.content:
Hi There

I have a couple of questions regarding the Certification Exam for "SAP Certified Professional - Solution Architect - SAP BTP" which is available in this link - https://learning.sap.com/certifications/sap-certified-professional-solution-architect-sap-btp

Question-1: Does this exam have any additional requirements apart from theoretical questions? I am asking this because this exam is named "Professional" instead of "Associate"

Question-2: In the above link under the section "Topics covered in this exam", I can only see "Exam percentage > 50%". What about the remaining percentage? Where can I get the list of topics for the remaining percentage?

Best Regards, Arul
